entries.title: The Papers: NHS crisis '500 deaths a week' and PM's 'headache'
entries.description: Warnings about the risk caused by NHS delays leads the front pages this Bank Holiday Monday.

entries.title: Takeaway offers free pizzas to everyone in Edinburgh
entries.description: Marc Wilkinson said he wanted to carry out an altruistic act to help people struggling with the cost of living.

entries.title: Leinster: URC leaders apologise after pro-IRA song played in stadium
entries.description: Leinster apologise after the Wolfe Tones song 'Celtic Symphony' was played following Sunday's win over Connacht at the RDS.

entries.title: Armchair shark detectives needed for Welsh project
entries.description: Volunteers are needed to help identify sharks, skates and rays as part of a conservation project.

entries.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Saka, Odegaard, De Gea, Toney, Silva, Shaw, Buendia, Gray
entries.description: Who is capable of doing special things? Who could make a future manager? It's Garth Crooks' Team of the Week.

entries.title: Tottenham 0-2 Aston Villa: Defensive frailties placing limit on Spurs' ambitions
entries.description: Following their New Year's Day loss to Aston Villa, Spurs are conceding goals at a rate not seen in the Premier League era.

entries.title: Nottingham Forest 1-1 Chelsea: Serge Aurier cancels out Raheem Sterling opener
entries.description: Nottingham Forest claim a valuable point in their relegation fight with a deserved draw against Chelsea, who lose ground on the Premier League top four.

entries.title: Warnings for ice and travel disruption in Scotland
entries.description: An ice alert is in force for the whole of Scotland and train services face a week of cancellations.

entries.title: Premiership: Northampton 46-17 Harlequins - Six-try Saints thrash sorry Quins
entries.description: James Ramm scores twice as Northampton run in six tries to thrash Harlequins 46-17 in the Premiership.

entries.title: Tottenham Hotspur 0-2 Aston Villa: Antonio Conte says Spurs lack creative players
entries.description: Tottenham Hotspur head coach Antonio Conte says his side do not have many creative players after their 2-0 defeat at home to Aston Villa in the Premier League.

entries.title: World Darts Championship: Michael Smith and Dimitri van den Bergh into semi-finals
entries.description: Michael Smith and Dimitri van den Bergh reach the World Darts Championship semi-finals.

entries.title: New York approves composting of human bodies
entries.description: It is the latest place to approve the process - considered to be greener than a burial or cremation.

entries.title: Barry Lane: Former Ryder Cup and European Tour golfer dies aged 62
entries.description: Former Ryder Cup player Barry Lane dies at the age of 62 after a short illness.

entries.title: Arctic walrus filmed returning to the sea in Scarborough
entries.description: A walrus, which has drawn large crowds since arriving in Scarborough on Saturday, is filmed returning to the sea.

entries.title: Tottenham 0-2 Aston Villa: Emiliano Buendia & Douglas Luiz increase pressure on Antonio Conte
entries.description: Second-half strikes from Emilano Buendia and Douglas Luiz earn Aston Villa victory at an unimpressive Tottenham.

entries.title: Ukraine must get long-term support, warns Nato chief
entries.description: The West must be in it for the "long haul" as Russia shows no signs of relenting, says Nato's chief.

entries.title: Viking Orion: Cruise passengers stranded after fungus halts ship
entries.description: The Viking Orion has been denied entry to Australia as a fungus is found growing on its hull.

entries.title: In pictures: London's New Year's Day parade
entries.description: More than 8,000 performers delight flag-waving crowds at an annual parade in central London.

entries.title: Judi Dench gigs with Sharleen Spiteri in hotel bar
entries.description: A viral video shows the pair performing a rendition of Abba's Waterloo in a Braemar hotel.

entries.title: Blackburn Rovers 1-0 Cardiff City: Bradley Dack goal boosts promotion hopes
entries.description: Blackburn Rovers claim just a second win from six games to revive their promotion hopes as Bradley Dack's deflected goal earns a 1-0 win against Cardiff City.

entries.title: United Cup: Great Britain beat Spain 3-1 to reach play-off
entries.description: Dan Evans gives Great Britain an unassailable 3-1 lead over Spain to ensure their progression to the play-off round of the inaugural United Cup.

entries.title: Lula to be sworn in as Brazil president as Bolsonaro flies to US
entries.description: The 77-year-old takes power as his predecessor Bolsonaro leaves the country to avoid the ceremony.

entries.title: Rangers v Celtic: No room for error for Michael Beale's men
entries.description: Rangers have no room for error as they take on Celtic at Ibrox on Monday trailing their rivals by nine points at the top of the Scottish Premiership.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Putin should face trial this year, says top lawyer
entries.description: Russia's leader is a "guilty man", says the barrister who led the case against Serbia's ex-leader Milosevic.

entries.title: Scarborough's New Year fireworks cancelled to protect walrus
entries.description: The council called off the fireworks display over concerns it "could cause distress to the mammal".

entries.title: Ukraine war: New year in Putin’s Russia - nothing is normal
entries.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg on the Kremlin's alternative reality as 2023 begins.

entries.title: Grammy-winning singer Anita Pointer dies aged 74
entries.description: She was a member of the Pointer Sisters, the 70s band whose hits included Jump (For My Love) and Fire.

entries.title: Wimbledon's ban on Russian and Belarusian players 'changed nothing' - Aryna Sabalenka
entries.description: Wimbledon's decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players from playing in the 2022 tournament "changed nothing", says world number five Aryna Sabalenka.

entries.title: RSPCA: Most 'weird and wonderful' animal rescues of 2022
entries.description: The RSPCA share some of the strangest animal rescues from the past year.

entries.title: Ben Nevis: Climber dies after avalanche on Scottish mountain
entries.description: Another man was seriously injured in the avalanche on the north face of the mountain.

entries.title: UK celebrates new year with spectacular fireworks
entries.description: The new year was marked with fireworks displays and street parties despite the wet weather.

entries.title: Watch how the world brought in 2023
entries.description: As the world turns more and more countries greet 2023.

entries.title: Cost of living crisis: Sickle cell families staying in bed for warmth
entries.description: Charity Oscar Birmingham says the cold leads to painful sickle cell flare-ups and hospital stays.

entries.title: Czechoslovakia: Czechs and Slovaks mark 30 years since Velvet Divorce
entries.description: Thirty years since their break-up, Slovakia and the Czech Republic have a harmonious relationship.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Ballerinas fight culture war against Russia
entries.description: The United Ukrainian Ballet represent the country's cultural frontline against the Russian invasion.

entries.title: Sound Of 2023: Earthquaking soul band Gabriels tipped for success
entries.description: The soul-quaking sounds of Gabriels have earned the band fifth place in Radio 1's Sound Of 2023 list.

entries.title: Love at first fight: The re-enactors who find romance
entries.description: Who needs online dating apps when you can meet eligible partners at the tip of a sword?

entries.title: How a secret message in a Colombian song gave hostages hope
entries.description: When the pop song Better Days was released in 2010, it contained a secret message hidden in the catchy tune.

entries.title: Archbishop of Canterbury calls for leaders to fix social care
entries.description: The Most Reverend Justin Welby uses his new year's message to highlight the social care crisis.

entries.title: Match of the Day analysis: Marcus Rashford shines for Manchester United off bench after being dropped
entries.description: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Danny Murphy analyse Marcus Rashford's performance at Wolves after he was dropped to the bench for internal disciplinary reasons.
